content.rendered:
Privacy Policy

Collection of Information from Website Visitors

We may collect and/or track the following information: (a) the Internet Protocol addresses for system administration and auditing site usage; (b) home server domain names, e-mail addresses, type of client computer, and type of Web browser of visitors to this Website, (c) the e-mail addresses of visitors that communicate with us via e-mail, (d) user-specific information on what pages visitors access; and (e) any other information you provide to us through the Website.

We may also use Internet cookies and other types of clickstream data on visitors’ hard drives. Internet cookies save, among other things, the visitor’s name, password, user-name, screen preferences, the pages of the Website viewed by the visitor, and the advertisements viewed or clicked by the visitor. Internet cookies are stored on the visitor’s hard drive and are not stored, in any form, by us. Visitors may decline the Internet cookies by using the appropriate feature of their Web client software, if available.

Use and Disclosure of Personal Information

Personal data, including, but not limited to, your name, address, email address and telephone number (“Personal Information”), that is collected by us will not be shared with third parties in a personally-identifiable form but may be used by us for purposes including, but not limited to, to protect our rights, property or to enforce the terms and conditions of this Website, to comply with laws, regulations, court orders or other legal processes, to contact you or otherwise respond to your request/inquiries, for editorial and feedback purposes, for marketing and promotional purposes, for a statistical analysis of user behavior, for product development, for content improvement, to inform advertisers as to how many visitors have seen or clicked on their advertisements, and to customize content and layout of our Website. In addition, Personal Information collected may be added to our databases and used for future calls and mailings regarding Website updates, new products and services and other announcements. We will not sell, exchange or publish your personal information without your permission, except as noted above or in conjunction with a corporate sale, merger, dissolution, acquisition, or other similar event. You also agree that we may share your Personal Information with others who help us with these activities.

Use and Disclosure of Anonymous Information

All information that is not personal to you or someone else, including, but not limited to, questions, comments, ideas and suggestions (“Anonymous Information”) shall be deemed non-confidential information and owned by us. We will not obtain your consent before posting collected data on our Website, or sharing, renting, selling, or otherwise disclosing Anonymous Information to third parties. We shall be free to disclose and use the Anonymous Information for any purpose and through any means without any obligations whatsoever to you. Further, we are free to use any ideas, inventions, concepts, know-how or techniques provided or submitted to us for any purpose whatsoever, including, but not limited to, developing, manufacturing and marketing new products and services.

Opt-Out

Visitors may opt out of having their Personal Information collected, used, or disclosed by us by contacting us. We can be contacted by e-mail at info@sientra.com.

Access to and Ability to Correct Personal Data

Upon request via e-mail we will provide to visitors a summary of any Personal Information retained by us. Visitors may modify, correct, change, or update their personal record or cause their personal record to be removed from our database. We will only send personal records to the e-mail address on file for the visitor name associated with it.

Collection of Personal Data from Children

Our Website is not intended for or marketed to persons under the age of 18. We do not collect or post information from children under the age of 13 (“children”) unless done so with the authorization of a parent or guardian. We do not and will not provide any personally identifying information collected from children, regardless of its source, to any third party for any purpose whatsoever. In the event a child submits information to our Website and we become aware of it, the child’s parent or guardian will receive an e-mail alerting them to the child’s registration and providing instructions on how the parent could delete the child’s registration, if so desired. No information collected from children is used for any marketing or promotional purposes whatsoever.

Our Right to Contact User

We reserve the right to contact Website visitors regarding this privacy policy, or any other terms and conditions, policies or agreements relevant to this Website.

Our Right to Change Privacy Policy

We reserve the right to change this policy at any time with or without notice. It is your responsibility to check back to this Website to review revisions and changes to this privacy policy. Specifically, we encourage you to review this privacy policy each and every time you visit the Website.
